entry.title: Our #RJResolutions for this new year? 1. Making Colorado a safe...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Our #RJResolutions for this new year?

1. Making Colorado a safe haven for reproductive healthcare and codifying it into law.
2. Breaking down structural barriers and ensuring Black, Brown, and Indigenous people have equitable access to reproductive healthcare.
3. Fighting back against policies and laws that deny bodily autonomy and affordable access to reproductive healthcare.

...

Whatever might get thrown our way, we're ready to defend access to reproductive healthcare.

See more

entry.title: Ronald Johnson, a 64-year-old grandfather who turned his life...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Ronald Johnson, a 64-year-old grandfather who turned his life around in prison has been granted clemency by Governor Polis. After serving more than 20 years of a 96-year sentence for nonviolent offenses, Mr. Johnson will now rejoin his community, family and daughter in Arkansas.

Redemption is real. Clemency is compassion.

ACLU of Colorado

Ronald Johnson is pre-diabetic, suffers from asthma and high blood pressure, and regularly uses an inhaler to breathe. His age and respiratory ailments put him ...at risk of serious illness and death if he contracts COVID-19. With over hundreds of active cases in Colorado’s prisons, his family fears he will not make it out alive. His daughter, Amber, says, “In prison, he can’t protect himself and he can’t social distance. My deep fear is that my dad will die in prison. That is an awful, traumatic reality to consider. My chest is tight just thinking about how quickly it spreads and how vulnerable he is.”

Governor Hickenlooper shortened his sentence following testimony from family, friends and correctional officers advocating for his early release. Yet, he is still eight years away from parole. While he remains in prison, COVID-19 continues to spread. Ronald’s three siblings, four children and four grandchildren are desperate for his release.

See more

entry.title: ACLU of Colorado applauds Governor Jared Polis for acting...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

ACLU of Colorado applauds Governor Jared Polis for acting decisively on Rogel Aguilera-Mederos’ case, as well as providing relief to Ronald Johnson and other individuals who received commutations or pardons. Extremely harsh prison sentences do not make us safer, are imposed disproportionately on Black and Brown communities, and waste taxpayer dollars.

But let us be clear: cases like these are not anomalies, they are an all-too-common consequence of decades of racially unjust “tough-on-crime” policies and mass incarceration.

Read our statement at: https://www.aclu-co.org/…/aclu-statement-governor-polis-cle…

DENVER — Yesterday, Governor Jared Polis granted commutations to three people including Ronald Johnson a

aclu-co.org

ACLU Statement on Governor Polis’ Clemency Announcement

DENVER — Yesterday, Governor Jared Polis granted commutations to three people including Ronald Johnson aDENVER — Yesterday, Governor Jared Polis granted commutations to three people including Ronald Johnson a

entry.title: As outrage grows around Rogel Aguilera-Mederos' unjust...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

As outrage grows around Rogel Aguilera-Mederos' unjust 110-year prison sentence, we are calling on all stakeholders involved in this unjustifiable outcome to use the existing tools — including resentencing, commutation, and restorative justice alternatives — to correct this shameful injustice.

Rally for Justice for Rogel Aguilera-Mederos
Tomorrow, Wednesday, Dec 22 at 10:30 A.M.
Colorado State Capitol steps

WED, DEC 22, 2021

Rally for Justice for Rogel Aguilera-Mederos

Colorado State CapitalCauses · 1,408 people

entry.title: A “report” with deficiencies this glaringly obvious cannot...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

A “report” with deficiencies this glaringly obvious cannot be taken seriously, and indeed, it is not intended to be. Rather than genuinely examining the root causes of crime and the best solutions, it strains to reach a foregone conclusion long-held by defenders of the “tough-on-crime” status quo driven by a clear political agenda.

https://coloradonewsline.com/…/splash-of-truth-colorado-cr…/

The attention received by the "Crime Wave" report was undeserved, because it's a cascade of suspect conclusions and conspicuous omissions.

coloradonewsline.com

A splash of truth about Colorado's 'crime wave' - Colorado Newsline

The attention received by the "Crime Wave" report was undeserved, because it's a cascade of suspect conclusions and conspicuous omissions.The attention received by the "Crime Wave" report was undeserved, because it's a cascade of suspect conclusions and conspicuous omissions.

entry.title: The recent uptick in Colorado’s otherwise historically low...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The recent uptick in Colorado’s otherwise historically low crime rates is a deeply serious concern, especially for those communities most impacted by violence and harm. We owe it to all Coloradans to stay focused on proven, long-term solutions that prevent violence and crime and lift our neighborhoods up. It would make Colorado less safe, and be a grave mistake, to double down on “tough on crime” practices that have caused intergenerational harm, financial loss, and damage to Colorado’s families.

Read more: https://www.aclu-co.org/…/statement-colorado-crime-wave-rep…

It would make Colorado less safe, and be a grave mistake, to double down on “tough on crime” practices that have caused intergenerational harm, financial loss, and damage to Colorado’s families.

aclu-co.org

Statement on Colorado Crime Wave report

It would make Colorado less safe, and be a grave mistake, to double down on “tough on crime” practices that have caused intergenerational harm, financial loss, and damage to Colorado’s families.It would make Colorado less safe, and be a grave mistake, to double down on “tough on crime” practices that have caused intergenerational harm, financial loss, and damage to Colorado’s families.

entry.title: In the wake of this horrible accident that tragically cost...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

In the wake of this horrible accident that tragically cost lives, we should all be examining what we can do to make sure something like this never happens again. Study after study, however, shows that outrageously long prison sentences simply do not improve public safety and merely pile more injustice on top of tragedy.

ACLU is calling on all the stakeholders involved in this unjustifiable outcome to use the existing tools that are available for precisely this moment–including resentencing, commutation, and restorative justice alternatives–to correct this shameful injustice.

Judge who sentenced Rogel Aguilera-Mederos lamented that he couldn’t opt for a lesser prison term

denverpost.com

Trucker’s 110-year sentence in fatal I-70 crash spotlights Colorado sentencing laws, prosecutors’ charging decisions

Judge who sentenced Rogel Aguilera-Mederos lamented that he couldn’t opt for a lesser prison termJudge who sentenced Rogel Aguilera-Mederos lamented that he couldn’t opt for a lesser prison term

entry.title: Harsh mandatory minimum requirements resulted in Rogel...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Harsh mandatory minimum requirements resulted in Rogel Aguilera-Mederos receiving life in prison for unintentionally taking the lives of four people. These requirements create severe racial disparities and reduce the discretion of judges. Until these practices are fixed, our justice system is anything but just.

So unjust is the 110-year prison sentence for Rogel Lazaro Aguilera-Mederos that we are asking Gov. Jared Polis to begin the process immediately for a clemency review that could reduce his time in …

denverpost.com

Editorial: Jared Polis, commute part of the 110-year sentence for Aguilera-Mederos

So unjust is the 110-year prison sentence for Rogel Lazaro Aguilera-Mederos that we are asking Gov. entry.title: bell hooks changed the world with her writing, addressing the...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

bell hooks changed the world with her writing, addressing the intersections of race, class, gender, place and sexuality with candor, intensity and love.

Thank you, bell hooks, for all you have given us.

The prolific author, poet, cultural critic, feminist and professor, who wrote more than three dozen wide-ranging books, died Wednesday at her home in Berea, Ky.

npr.org

Trailblazing feminist author, critic and activist bell hooks has died at 69

The prolific author, poet, cultural critic, feminist and professor, who wrote more than three dozen wide-ranging books, died Wednesday at her home in Berea, Ky.The prolific author, poet, cultural critic, feminist and professor, who wrote more than three dozen wide-ranging books, died Wednesday at her home in Berea, Ky.

entry.title: It’s not too late to give to ACLU of Colorado this Colorado...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

It’s not too late to give to ACLU of Colorado this Colorado Gives Day! Pledge your support now at https://acluco.org/COGivesDay21 and join us in our fight to “close the gap between the America that was promised and the America that is.”

entry.title: We’re halfway through Colorado Gives Day! Pledge your support...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

We’re halfway through Colorado Gives Day! Pledge your support at https://acluco.org/COGivesDay21 to help safeguard our democracy, protect voting rights, decriminalize homelessness, defend reproductive rights, among much more this Colorado Gives Day!

entry.title: Happy Colorado Gives Day! As the ACLU begins its second century...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Happy Colorado Gives Day! As the ACLU begins its second century of protecting civil rights and liberties, we are centering systemic equality to ensure we reflect the diversity of our clients and the communities we serve. Keep this work going by pledging your support at https://acluco.org/COGivesDay21.

entry.title: Safeguarding our democracy and protecting voting rights are...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Safeguarding our democracy and protecting voting rights are critical to “closing the gap between the America that was promised and the America that is.” Pre-pledge to ACLU of Colorado for Colorado Gives Day on December 7 at https://acluco.org/COGivesDay21.

entry.title: Don’t forget to join us today at 5:30 pm MST to learn more...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Don’t forget to join us today at 5:30 pm MST to learn more about your reproductive rights in Colorado and New Mexico. Register at bit.ly/2Z3WnBO.

entry.title: As Coloradans, we emphatically support the right to reproductive...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

As Coloradans, we emphatically support the right to reproductive freedom and abortion care. We have rejected countless political attempts to restrict abortion and we are done playing defense. Now is the time to move Colorado — Beyond The Bans.

entry.title: Today, the conservative-majority SCOTUS will hear the case with...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Today, the conservative-majority SCOTUS will hear the case with the power to overturn Roe v. Wade. Join us as we gather in support of abortion rights today at 1 p.m. at the CO Capitol. We’ll hear from elected officials and organizations committed to reproductive rights.

entry.title: Closing the gap between the America that was promised and the...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Closing the gap between the America that was promised and the America that is requires audacious goals and steadfast support. Make the American promise a reality. Pre-pledge your Colorado Gives Day donation at acluco.org/COGivesDay21.

The only way to transformational change is together.

entry.title: The Colorado Constitution, Colorado statutes, and now the Court...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The Colorado Constitution, Colorado statutes, and now the Court have made it loud and clear: A person's past doesn't decide whether or not they can serve in public office — the voters do.

An Arapahoe County judge has permanently blocked Aurora from enforcing against a 2021 council candidate the city charter's prohibition on people holding elected office if they have ever received a

coloradopolitics.com

Judge blocks Aurora from enforcing felony ban against ex-council candidate
